newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Tuesday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover fell slightly to 1.8 billion yuan from 1.9 billion yuan on Monday with the 60-day contract the most active.

Traders said the 60-day contract was once again the most active. There was little interest in selling early-maturing contracts ahead of the Chinese lunar new year holiday, and that drove those rates higher.
There was no trading in the 30-day contract which stood at 11.541 percent on Monday.
Big state-owned banks were cautious due to rumours that the People's Bank would cut deposit and lending rates in the first quarter this year, traders said.
"A cut in interest rates is possible in the first quarter and the market seems to be waiting for news of this after the national bank meeting next week," a local trader said.
Senior officials of the central bank and other financial institutions will meet in Beijing next week for a national policy conference, officials have said.
